chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Gustav R Schreiber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault), a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To commence immediately and is to be concurrent with the Winnebago County case.

superMiscConds.notes: Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

-Sex Offender Assessment and any follow-up.
-Follow all sex offender policies of the department.
-No Contact with any females under the age of 18 years.
-DNA Sample.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Defendant is to have No Contact with the victim; with the exception that after the victim turns 18 years old, the victim and the defendant's agent agree that contact is appropriate.

2:33 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Catherine Malchow.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Malchow - have 3 witnesses.

Barbara Privat sworn, direct by Atty Malchow. Represented the defendant in the Green Lake County case.  Testimony given.  Cross exam by ADA Vanden Branden.  Re-direct by Atty Malchow.  Witness excused.

Brianne Patzer sworn, direct by Atty Malchow.  Represented the defendant in the Winnebago County case.  Testimony given.  Cross exam by ADA Vanden Branden.  Objection by Atty Malchow.  Sustained by the court.  Witness excused.
Gustav Schreiber sworn, direct by Atty Malchow.  Testimony given.  Cross exam by ADA Vanden Branden. Re-direct by Atty Malchow.  Re-cross by ADA Vanden Branden.  Court questions witness.  Re-cross by ADA Vanden Branden.
Atty Malchow offers Defendant's exhibit #1 - email between counsel.  No objection by ADA Vanden Branden.  Court receives Exhibit #1.  Statement by the Court regarding the other exhibits, are already a part of the record.

Argument by Atty Malchow.  Argument by ADA Vanden Branden.  Court makes statement to Atty Malchow.  Statement by Atty Malchow.  
Statement by the Court - denies the motion.

Court adjourned at 3:34 p.m.
It is ORDERED, that the time for deciding the defendant's postconviction motion is extended to November 27, 2017.

records.addlTxt:
2:09 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  State has received a copy of the revocation packet/presentence investigation report, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing argument by ADA.  Sentencing argument by Atty Privat.  Statement by defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

35 years of Initial Confinement and 20 years of Extended Supervision, concurrent to the Winnebago County case.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

-Court costs.  Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
-Sex Offender Assessment and any follow-up.
-Follow all sex offender policies of the department.
-No Contact with any females under the age of 18 years.
-DNA Sample.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Defendant is to have No Contact with the victim, with the exception that after the victim turns 18 years old the victim and the defendant's agent agree that contact is appropriate.

Court finds the defendant not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Sentence is to commence immediately and remands the defendant to the custody of the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

Court grants the defendant 345 days of sentence credit.

Court adjourned at 2:32.m.
Dodge Correctional Institution - 06/21/2016 at 1:30 p.m. (Sentencing)

Sentencing hearing at 06-21-2016 02:00 pm

2:33 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat. Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 and counts 2 & 3 will be dismissed and read-in with a request for Presentence Investigation report.  State concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions. 

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders counts 2 & 3 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Court orders a presentence investigation be conducted and filed with the court.  Upon filing, copies are to be disbursed. 

Statement by Atty Privat in regards to a PSI ordered in the Winnebago County case.  State has no objection to using the PSI that was ordered in Winnebago County case.  Court will allow the PSI to be used in this case - Clerk to contact the writer of the PSI.  Court sets for Sentencing on June 21, 2016 at 2:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:44 p.m.
